title: Job: I Know My Redeemer Lives
summary: Job feels alienated and attacked by God and abandoned by friends. Yet, in the midst of suffering, he declares faith in a living Redeemer who will one day vindicate him, even after death.

faq.question: What famous statement does Job make in this chapter?
faq.answer: 'I know that my Redeemer lives, and that in the end He will stand on the earth.'

faq.question: Why is this chapter significant?
